column1: Your menstrual flow may come to a sudden halt after surgeries to remove your ovaries, chemotherapy, or certain hormone treatments for breast cancer.
Your health care provider may have prescribed hormone therapy to relieve symptoms of menopause such as hot flashes, sleep problems, and vaginal symptoms.
Smoking will increase the chance of blood clots in your legs or your lungs.
Eat a healthy diet that is low in fat and includes lots of fruits and vegetables.
- Milk and other dairy products contain tryptophan, which may help induce sleep.
- Alcohol may make your symptoms worse and often leads to a more disrupted sleep.
Kegel exercises can help with vaginal muscle tone and help you control urine leakage.
Ask your provider about what you should do to control your blood pressure, cholesterol, and other risk factors for heart disease.
